body: I want to get a server for me and porky, (scrimming + more) but hamatchi is way too complicated for most people and I have no idea how to portforward my computer.... I want a server like steven's if possible.... thanks for any help, if not may I know a site where I can rent servers (cheap but good ones please)

title: Server Making Help?

replies.body: Sadly I think we will have to port forward :/
replies.body_tagged: Sadly I think we will have to port forward :/

replies.body:
Beastnode.
Great for small servers and cheap.

You can even set up a address (yourserver.beastmc.com)
It's the host OCN uses, so you can use the code "OCN" for 25% off.

[removed]

replies.body: Port forwarding is fine for just you and some people to do some pvp. Don't use hamachi, it is way to laggy and is just annoying. Hosting is more for owners who want their server to be public.
replies.body_tagged: Port forwarding is fine for just you and some people to do some pvp. Don't use hamachi, it is way to laggy and is just annoying. Hosting is more for owners who want their server to be public.

replies.body: Does anyone know if 1gb of ram is enough to host a server like avicus?
replies.body_tagged: Does anyone know if 1gb of ram is enough to host a server like avicus?

replies.body:
If you want to start a small server for your friends, I recommend learning how to port forward, this video can help:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ye_BnHAEJGU
It's easier than it sounds.

If you want to start a server and make it public, and have a bunch of minigames, I would recommend MCProHosting or HostHorde, HostHorde has a $25 unlimited ram plan.
replies.body_tagged:
